meta.title: Caribbean Family Cruise Adventure
meta.destination: Western Caribbean Cruise from Fort Lauderdale
meta.dates: Sample dates - customize for your client
meta.status: Sample trip template - ready to customize

dates.notes: 7-night cruise + 2 hotel nights (pre/post). Adjust dates based on sail date availability.

budget.notes: Estimate for family of 4 including flights, cruise, 1 pre-cruise night, shore excursions, and specialty dining.

outbound.notes: Arrive by early afternoon to enjoy pre-cruise evening
outbound.tips: Book morning flight to avoid stress if delays occur

return.notes: Afternoon flight recommended - ship docks early but debarkation takes time
return.tips: Don't book before 1pm to allow for customs and transport

cabin.notes: Accommodates 4 guests. Request connecting rooms or larger category for more space.

embarkation.tips: Priority boarding available with drink packages or suite guests

debarkation.tips: Self-assist debark is fastest if you can carry your own bags

lodging.name: Pre-Cruise Hotel - Fort Lauderdale
lodging.map: Fort Lauderdale, FL near Port Everglades
lodging.notes: Stay near port for stress-free embarkation. Pool a plus for kids! Options: Hilton Marina, Marriott Harbor Beach, or budget-friendly options further from port.

lodging.name: Cruise Ship - 7 Nights
lodging.notes: All meals included. Balcony cabin recommended for family of 4 - extra space and private outdoor area.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Fort Lauderdale

activities.name: Arrive & Check into Hotel
activities.description: Arrive at FLL, transfer to hotel. Relax after flight - pool time for the kids!

activities.name: Las Olas Boulevard Dinner
activities.description: Stroll the palm-lined boulevard with shops and restaurants. Great family-friendly options from casual to upscale.

meals: Dinner on Las Olas or near hotel
tips: Pre-cruise option: Everglades airboat tour (book in advance if interested)
Family tip: Kids will have energy to burn - hotel pool is your friend!

itinerary.title: Embarkation Day!

activities.name: Pre-Cruise Breakfast & Packing
activities.description: Leisurely hotel breakfast. Double-check passports, cruise documents, and carry-on essentials.

activities.name: Transfer to Port Everglades
activities.description: Short drive/shuttle to cruise terminal. Check-in process typically 30-60 minutes.
activities.notes: Uber/Lyft ~$15, hotel shuttle may be free

activities.name: Board the Ship!
activities.description: Explore the ship while cabins are being prepared. Hit the buffet for lunch - it's included! Attend muster drill (mandatory safety briefing).

activities.name: Explore & Unpack
activities.description: Cabins ready around 1:30pm. Unpack, explore kids' clubs, and find key venues: main dining room, pool deck, guest services.

activities.name: Sail Away Party!
activities.description: Don't miss the sail-away from the top deck! Live music, first sunset at sea, and that magical moment when the ship leaves port.

activities.name: First Dinner & Show
activities.description: Main dining room dinner (included) or try a specialty restaurant. Evening show in the main theater - great family entertainment.

tips: Pro tip: Carry swimsuits in your day bag - pools open at noon before cabins are ready
Kids club tip: Register the kids on day 1 so they can drop in throughout the cruise

activities.name: Family Pool Time
activities.description: Main pool deck, waterslides, and kids' splash areas. Best time: right after breakfast when it's less crowded.

activities.name: Teen Zone Check-In
activities.description: Let your teen explore the dedicated teen club - video games, movies, and age-appropriate activities with new cruise friends.

activities.name: Adventure Activities
activities.description: Try the rock climbing wall, FlowRider surf simulator, or mini-golf. Most ships have multiple family-friendly activities.

activities.name: Adult Escape: Spa or Adults-Only Deck
activities.description: While kids are at their clubs: couples massage, thermal suite, or quiet pool time in the adults-only retreat.

activities.name: Kids Club Programming
activities.description: Science experiments, treasure hunts, and themed activities for the 9-year-old. Supervised and free!

activities.name: Elegant Night Dinner
activities.description: First formal night! Dress up for photos and a special menu in the main dining room.

activities.name: Family Game Show or Trivia
activities.description: Many ships have nightly family activities - game shows, trivia, and deck parties.

adults: Book spa treatments on sea days - port days are quieter there
Adults-only areas are perfect during kids club hours
teen: Teen clubs come alive on sea days - great chance to make cruise friends
Most ships have teen-only pool parties and movie nights
child: Kids clubs have the best programming on sea days
Morning is best for pools before they get crowded
family: Family trivia competitions are surprisingly fun!
Order room service for a lazy morning on the balcony

itinerary.title: Cozumel, Mexico

activities.name: Early Off - Beat the Crowds
activities.description: Be among the first off the ship. Crowds build by 10am as multiple ships disembark.

activities.name: OPTION A: Chankanaab National Park
activities.description: All-ages adventure: snorkeling in crystal-clear lagoons, sea lion encounters, Dolphin Discovery (additional cost). Beach chairs and clear water.
activities.notes: Taxi ~$15 each way, or book ship excursion with transport

activities.name: OPTION B: Snorkel Tour (Independent)
activities.description: Book a local snorkel tour to Palancar or Colombia reef - among the world's best! More adventurous, great for teens.
activities.notes: Book in advance via Viator or local operator

activities.name: Downtown Cozumel & Lunch
activities.description: Stroll the town square, shop for souvenirs, grab tacos and fresh guacamole. Authentic Mexican food at local prices.

activities.name: Return to Ship Early
activities.description: Beat the rush back. Pool deck is empty when everyone's ashore - perfect time for the waterslides!

meals: Lunch in town or at beach
crowdAvoidance: Be first off the ship - 8:15am vs 10am makes a huge difference
Consider independent excursions that go to different spots than ship tours
Return to ship by 2pm - empty pools and no tender wait
Skip the port shopping area right by the ship - walk 10 minutes into town for better prices
tips: Money tip: Mexican pesos get better prices, but USD widely accepted
Don't buy jewelry at port shops - same items on ship duty-free

itinerary.title: Grand Cayman

portInfo.tenderNote: Tender port - get in line early or late to avoid the crush

activities.name: First Tender Strategy
activities.description: Get tender tickets at 6:30am. First tenders leave around 7:30am. Alternatively, wait until 10am when initial rush clears.

activities.name: OPTION A: Stingray City
activities.description: World-famous sandbar where you can touch and feed wild stingrays in waist-deep water. Magical family experience!
activities.notes: Book early - sells out. Ship excursion or independent catamaran tour.

activities.name: OPTION B: Seven Mile Beach
activities.description: Stunning public beach - no excursion needed. Take a taxi ($5-7/person), rent chairs ($15), and enjoy pristine Caribbean water.

activities.name: George Town Walk
activities.description: Duty-free shopping and waterfront walk. Margaritaville for lunch or Guy's Burger Joint equivalent on shore.

activities.name: Early Return
activities.description: Tender lines get long after 2pm. Head back by 1:30pm for quick return.

crowdAvoidance: Tender ports require strategy - very first or mid-morning is best
Stingray City: Book first available time slot (less crowded than midday)
Seven Mile Beach: Taxi drivers know the less crowded sections - ask!
Return tender by 1:30pm or wait until 3pm (everyone returns 2-2:30pm)
tips: Currency: Cayman dollars or USD (USD widely accepted at slight premium)
Stingray City: Underwater cameras highly recommended - rentable on excursions

itinerary.title: Jamaica - Falmouth

activities.name: OPTION A: Dunn's River Falls
activities.description: Iconic waterfall climb! Terraced falls you climb hand-in-hand as a group. Wet, adventurous, and unforgettable.
activities.notes: Ship excursion recommended - includes transport (1 hour drive). Bring water shoes!

activities.name: OPTION B: Bamboo Rafting on Martha Brae
activities.description: Peaceful 3-mile float down the Martha Brae River on a bamboo raft. Relaxing alternative - great for all ages.

activities.name: OPTION C: Stay on Ship
activities.description: Skip this port and enjoy an empty ship! Pool deck, spa, specialty lunch - it's like having the ship to yourselves.

activities.name: Falmouth Historic Walk
activities.description: If not on excursion, the port area has Georgian architecture and local craft vendors. Stay in the port area for security.

crowdAvoidance: Dunn's River Falls: First time slot (usually 9:30am) has shorter wait to climb
Staying aboard is a legitimate strategy - Jamaican ports are crowded
If exploring town, Falmouth's port area is contained and walkable
tips: Safety: Stick to excursions or port area. Don't venture independently.
Water shoes essential for Dunn's River Falls

itinerary.title: Sea Day - Family Fun

activities.name: Sleep In & Room Service
activities.description: Order breakfast to the cabin and eat on the balcony. After 3 ports, you've earned it!

activities.name: Morning Activities Split
activities.description: Adults: fitness center or quiet time. Teen: sports deck or video arcade. Child: morning kids club session.

activities.name: Family Competition Time
activities.description: Mini golf tournament, ping pong, or basketball on the sports deck. Many ships have family Olympics events.

activities.name: Specialty Lunch (Optional)
activities.description: Treat yourselves to the specialty burger joint, pizza parlor, or hibachi. Most are included or low-cost.

activities.name: Pool & Waterslide Marathon
activities.description: Final full day for ship activities! Race down the waterslides, try the FlowRider, or just float in the pool.

activities.name: Captain's Farewell Dinner
activities.description: Final formal night with special menu. Photos in your finest, baked Alaska parade in the dining room.

activities.name: Farewell Show & Deck Party
activities.description: Final evening entertainment. Many ships do a deck party with dancing under the stars.

adults: Final spa treatments at discount - check for last-day specials
Pack tonight to avoid morning rush
teen: Teen club often has late-night party on final sea day
Exchange contact info with cruise friends
child: Kids club farewell party - supervised so adults can enjoy dinner
Start packing early, leave out tomorrow's outfit
family: Take final ship photos today - tomorrow is hectic
Settle onboard accounts tonight at guest services

itinerary.notes: Pack tonight! Leave out one outfit for tomorrow. Settlement of shipboard account happens automatically unless you have questions.

itinerary.title: Private Island Day

activities.name: First Tender to Island
activities.description: Private island days are crowded by 10am. First tender gets best beach chairs!

activities.name: Beach Day!
activities.description: Crystal clear water, BBQ lunch (included), and family beach time. This is why you came to the Caribbean!

activities.name: Snorkel Rental or Water Sports
activities.description: Kayaks, paddleboards, snorkel gear available for rent. Some activities included with cruise fare.

activities.name: Island Exploration
activities.description: Walking trails, nature areas, and often a splash pad/water park for kids. Take the family photo with the island backdrop!

activities.name: Final Ship Return
activities.description: Return by 2pm for smooth tender experience. Final sunset sail-away from your balcony.

activities.name: Final Dinner & Shows
activities.description: Last night aboard! Enjoy dinner and catch any shows you missed. Many ships have a final farewell performance.

crowdAvoidance: First tender: arrive at tender meeting spot 30 minutes early
Walk past the first beach area - further beaches are less packed
Return to ship for lunch instead of island BBQ (empty ship!)
Last tender has long waits - leave island by 2:30pm
tips: Bring towels from ship (or they provide at island)
Waterproof phone case essential for beach photos
Apply sunscreen liberally - island sun is intense

itinerary.title: Debarkation Day

activities.name: Wake Up & Final Breakfast
activities.description: Ship docks ~7am. Enjoy final breakfast in dining room or grab-and-go from buffet.

activities.name: Debarkation
activities.description: Self-assist debark (carry your own bags) exits first ~8am. Otherwise, wait for your color group to be called (8:30-10:30am).
activities.notes: Have passports ready, settle any outstanding charges night before

activities.name: Transfer to Airport
activities.description: Taxi, Uber, or shuttle to FLL airport. ~15 minutes from port. Arrive 2 hours before domestic flight.

activities.name: Flight Home
activities.description: Afternoon flight recommended. Don't book before 1pm - debarkation can run late!

tips: Pro tip: Self-assist debark if you can carry all your bags - you'll be off 1-2 hours earlier
Customs is usually quick (30 min) but budget extra time
Don't book early flights - 1pm+ is safest

value.name: Family Value
value.description: Great cruise experience with smart savings
includes: 1 ship excursion (Stingray City or Dunn's River)

premium.name: Family Adventure
premium.description: Our recommendation - balcony cabin and key excursions
includes: 2-3 shore excursions (Stingray City, Dunn's River, Beach Day)

luxury.name: Ultimate Family Cruise
luxury.description: Suite life with all the extras

tiers.notes: Cruise pricing varies dramatically by sail date, cabin availability, and booking timing. Early booking and repositioning cruises offer best value.

featuredLinks.title: Cruise Line Official Site
featuredLinks.description: Replace with actual cruise line when booked

seaDays.overview: Sea days are when the ship's activities shine. Don't try to do everything - pick a few highlights and relax.

portDays.overview: Crowds follow the herd. Be first off OR last off, never middle. Return to ship mid-afternoon for empty pool.
strategies: Early risers: First tender/walkoff, finish excursion by noon, lunch on empty ship
Late starters: Skip morning rush, depart 10am, enjoy less crowded port, stay until all-aboard
Ship day: Stay aboard when others leave - it's like having a private cruise ship

dining.familyTip: Main dining room anytime dining works best for families - no set time commitment

notes.customization: This is a sample cruise trip showing the system's capabilities. Customize cruise line, ship, dates, and activities to match your client's preferences.
notes.bookingReminder: Cruise cabins sell out - book early for best selection, especially balconies and suites.
notes.familyTip: Connecting cabins or larger family staterooms make a huge difference with kids. Worth the upgrade!
